alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 1:16PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL CAMERON AND NORTHWESTERN CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 115 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 23 miles east of St. Marys, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Keating, Renovo, South Renovo, Westport, Tamarack, Stevenson Dam, Kettle Creek State Park and Driftwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and north central Pennsylvania.
